title: E-Commerce 2019

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK (including foreign owned businesses) unless otherwise stated. The UK consists of England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland and excludes the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures aren’t available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: View the questions before you start the survey (external link)
You will need to provide the percentage of people who use computers for their work.

questions.question: Access and use of the internet

content.description: You will need to provide information on the percentage of people in the business who use computers, the type of broadband connection and download speed, use of portable devices, websites, and social media.
You will need to provide information on the percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originated.
You will need to provide information on any e-invoices and non-electronic invoices, including paper invoices.
You will need to provide information on any cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet.
You will need to provide information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data by your business.
You will need to provide information on your business's employment and training of ICT specialists.
You will need to provide information on the use of specialist printers for the use of three-dimensional printing of physical objects.
You will need to provide information on the use of industrial and service robots.

list: You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
The information you provide is used to measure how businesses are adopting new technology and engaging in e-commerce, as part of the digital economy.

other portable devices such as smartphones and Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs)
terminals and computers solely used for Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS)

list: all agency staff on your payroll

answers.description: Provide percentages to one decimal place where possible

blocks.title: E-commerce
blocks.description:
In this section, you will need to provide information on the percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originated.

E-commerce is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing of orders. The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

questions.title: During 2019, did {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} receive any orders from customers for goods or services via a website or 'app'?

list: orders received for utilities, goods, materials or services via an online store, web forms on a website or extranet or 'app'
reservations made online that resulted in receiving an order
orders made by manually typed email, Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) messages, fax, automated telephone entry, phone (person to person)
enquiries or reservations that did not result in receiving an order

options.label: Yes, we received orders via a website or 'app'
No, we did not receive orders via a website or 'app'

questions.title: During 2019, what percentage of {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }}'s total turnover was from orders received via a website or 'app'?

questions.title: During 2019, did {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} receive any orders from customers for goods or services via EDI-type messages?

list: orders received for utilities, goods, materials or services using internet and non-internet EDI-type messages and automated telephone entry

enquiries that did not result in receiving an order

definitions.title: What are Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) messages?

content.description: EDI-type messages allow the exchange of business documents between trading partners in a standard or structured machine-readable format. EDI is used to electronically transfer documents such as purchase orders, invoice or shipping bills. Businesses should be able to process this data without having to manually record it (i.e. processing should be automated).

options.label: Yes, we received orders via EDI-type messages
No, we did not receive orders via EDI-type messages

content.description: Cloud computing means services used over the internet, including connections via Virtual Private Networks (VPN) to access software, computing power, storage capacity etc.

list: are delivered from servers of service providers
can be used as an on-demand self-service, at least after set up (without human interaction with a service provider)
can be scaled up or down, for example for a change in number of users or storage capacity
are paid by use or per capacity used, or they are prepaid

blocks.title: Big data
blocks.description: In this section, you will need to provide information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data by your business.

questions.title: During 2019, did {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} use any of the following sources to analyse big data?

content.description: "Big Data" is the study of large data sets that are generated from electronic activities and from machine-to-machine communications, for example, from social media or production processes. Big data analysis refers to the use of techniques, technologies and software tools for analysing large data sets from your own business or other data sources.

list: vast amounts of data generated over time.
variety in terms of different formats of complex data, either structured or unstructured (for example text, video, images, voice, docs, sensor data, activity logs, click streams, coordinates).
velocity in terms of the high speed at which data are generated, become available and change over time.

options.label: The business's own data from smart devices or sensors
options.value: The business's own data from smart devices or sensors
options.description: For example, machine to machine communications, digital sensors, RFID tags

options.label: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.value: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.description: For example, portable devices using mobile telephone networks, wireless connections or GPS

options.label: Data generated from social media
options.description: For example, social networks, blogs, multimedia content sharing websites

options.label: Other big data sources not specified above
options.value: Other big data sources not specified above

values: The business's own data from smart devices or sensors
Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
Other big data sources not specified above

blocks.title: Use of robotics
blocks.description: In this section, you will need to provide information on the use of industrial and service robots.

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} use industrial robots?

content.description: Exclude service robots (with a degree of autonomy)

An industrial robot is an automatically controlled, reprogrammable, multipurpose manipulator programmable in three or more axes, which may be either fixed in place or mobile for use. Most existing industrial robots are based on the robot arm with a solid base and a series of links and joints with an end effector that carries out the task.

options.label: Yes, we use industrial robots
No, we do not use industrial robots

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} use service robots?

list: robots used for industrial automation applications

content.description: A service robot is a machine that has a degree of autonomy that enables it to operate in complex and dynamic environments, and may require interaction with persons, objects or other devices. They are designed to fit their tasks, working in the air (e.g. as a drone), under water, or on land, using wheels or legs to achieve mobility with arms and end effectors to physically interact; they are often used in inspection and maintenance tasks.

options.label: Yes, we use service robots
No, we do not use service robots

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item((metadata['trad_as']), (metadata['ru_name'])) }} use service robots for any of the following activities?

options.description: For example, the use of autonomous airborne drones

options.description: For example, the use of automated guided vehicles

options.label: Cleaning or waste disposal tasks
Warehouse management systems
options.description: For example, loading and moving pallets or handling goods

options.label: Assembly works performed by service robots
options.value: Assembly works performed by service robots

options.label: Robotic store clerk tasks
Construction works or damage repair tasks

Construction works or damage repair tasks
